We're here often because it's an easy walk from our house and the pizza is delicious!  It's wonderful to have the Slice House by Tony Gemignani on Haight Street.  
Our go-to pizza orders are slices of cheese or pepperoni, extra crispy. Purple Haze and Grandma are favorites, too.
Our vegetarian friends were happily sated with their mixed greens salad and Gemeli pasta.
Is everyone happy?  Absolutely!  The staff is always welcoming and friendly.
author: Geri S.

description: Don't bother with this place! Terrible! Waited 45 min. for two whole pizzas. Rub insult to injury, they are COLD. $62 wasted. Thumbs down!!! Terrible! Waited 45 min. for a whole pizza and I'm still waiting. Thumbs down!!! Terrible! Waited 45 min. for a whole pizza and I'm still waiting. Thumbs down!!!
author: Mike L.

description: So disappointing. I've had north beach's slice house pizza a few times & liked it. This Haight St. location is nothing like it. The crust sucks, its not cooked thoroughly & it is pretty flavorless. This review is for The Wiseguy & Crazy 8 pizzas. Maybe the basic pepperoni or non-specialty pizza is better. Add this to the long list of horrible pizza in SF. Believe all the negative reviews. Don't order from here.
author: San X.

description: $5 for a slice of cheese would make anyone think twice. The slice is huge! Pretty much two slices in one. This spot is located inside the Market and has some tasty looking pizza  selections. Service is quick, ingredients are fresh, the quality is there. Stop by for a slice or a box!
author: J M.

description: I don't appreciate going to a restaurant that doesn't keep their advertised hours. I went by tonite about 9:30.  The place was supposed to be open until 10.  The place was closed and the chairs were up on tables as if they had closed quite awhile before and had already cleaned up.  Can't comment on the food, but obviously no concern for their customers!
author: Dan D.

description: We walked down Haight last night with some out of state family and this pizza place caught our eye! The 5 of us all raved about how delicious this place was and how we'd definitely stop by again while in the area! We had the Meat Lovers, Purple haze and Grandma, all perfectly seasoned, crispy, cheesy and delicious! We also shared a side of garlic fries, that were freshly made after our order..garlic perfection, grab some lemonade too! You need to stop by and have a slice to understand the hype!
author: Ámbar B.

description: The cheese slice was tasty. The pepperoni was way too greasy. $5 for a slice of cheese pizza isn't good enough value for this local to come back. You need two to be full, which including tax and tip puts you over $12. I can get a great sandwich across the street at Haight Ashbury market for $8-9, and that will have much more diverse flavors.
author: Thom N.

description: I have been a fan of Tony's pizza for years. I've been to his places in North Beach & by the ballpark. This location is true to the high level of quality at Tony's other restaurants. But this one is near my home AND once they start delivery, I'll be in their delivery range - hurray!! One this first visit, I got multiple single slices of pizza, they were all delish but what can I say - I loved the classic pepperoni slice so much. Look forward to coming back for the meatball sandwich AND ordering pies for delivery.
author: Rochelle M.

description: Cool space! The pizza was great and the service was stellar. It's Haight-Ashbury so kind of touristy.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Give it to me baby. Give me that stuff that awesome stuff! Had a couple of slices on a rainy night. It wasn't busy cuz of the weather. Hot and crispy out of the oven (not so much at Escape from New York. lukewarm pizza is a drag). One had potatoes on it (wonderful!) and the other one had jalapenos and it was killer. Spicy oil on the table if you like it even spicier. I'm not a crust eater, but with that oil, fab. It's a little more expensive than some places but it's so delicious and they're big slices. The space is clean and looks like a restaurant, not a fast food joint. This is my new fave. (There's a reason this guy wins pizza making contests).
author: Nini M.

description: Girl and I got a whole "small" Wiseguy Pizza to share and brought in tallboy beers from the Liquor store nearby (Pizza needs beer). Hopefully Slice house can get some beer up in this joint! Pizza was tasty and we had leftovers for later!
author: Aaron S.

description: I've been coming to this spot for a good 10 years when it was fat slice now that it has change I am very disappointed the old recipes were way better and the service was way better I heard the cashier tell a paying customer they had to walk down the street to a public bathroom when I have been in there bathroom in the back many of times I know they wanted change to accommodate a higher paying customer base or that's what they told me the 1st time I came after the change but like I said I would have gave the old place 5 plus stars this is not good pizza for returning customers
author: Jeanine F.

description: Best cheap lunch in mid-market: a slice here. Everything I've had is good, but my two favorites are the sweet grandma and the purple potato. Not nearly enough seating, but it's not a big deal.
author: Jack P.

description: Best New York style pizza in SF. I ought to know. Every time I walk by The Market my mouth starts watering.
author: Patrick F.

description: The Cal Italia pizza was excellent. I'd definitely eat here again! Awesome crust! Different flavors than usual!
author: Simon S.

description: California Dreamin. I know it's mostly about the pizza here but you have to try this sandwich. Just enough peppers to make it spicy, but not so hot that you can't taste the chicken and bacon. Plus the very courteous young ladies were very patient with me. Hope to be back soon.
author: Alberto D.

description: It's Tony's and without the two hour wait like the one in North Beach!
author: George M.

description: Ate there yesterday. Food was good, but it took way too long to get our side salads. We got them after our pizza slice, which doesn't make sense. Non soda refills either.
author: Gretchen L.

description: Wonderful delicious pizza in beautiful place Very pleasant atmosphere. Fast service and nice prices. Kind and friendly staff.
author: Finley F.

description: Great Grandma slice!  And a wonderful spicy pasta too boot.
author: Benjamin I.

description: Came in for lunch the other day because I heard Tony G had a new Slice House in the neighborhood, and it was top notch pizza! The decor of the restaurant is awesome and fits great in the Haight Ashbury neighborhood. Try the Purple Haze and the house made lemonade, both are excellent! Don't forget to leave without a cool Tee shirt as well. Great job Slice House!
author: Tommy P.

description: If you've ever been to one of Tony's pizzerias before you know what a treat you're in for. If you haven't, her there now. Amazing pizza made with the upmost respect for the craft. This new location is decorated to fit the Haight district and it's awesome. Another home run for Tony. And grab a shirt while you're there.
author: Angie S.

description: Solid slice.  If you're expecting it to be as good as their brick and mortar location in North Beach, you will be disappointed.  $6/slice, a bit on the pricier side.  The funghi is usually well-balanced but on occasion is overwhelmed by the olives.
author: Amber M.

description: Excellent in every way! The pizza is of exquisite quality--crisp, with a crust that balances sponginess and hardness perfectly--and is ready virtually instantly. The atmosphere is great, too: friendly staff, retro decor and appealing background music make for an overall great experience.
author: Dan S.

description: Everything I've tried here so far is amazing! The pizzas are great. The pastas were the surprise. Add the amazing meatballs to the pastas and it's a satisfying meal.
author: GK S.

description: Yawn... This place is a mess. There is always confusion when ordering just pizza. It's changed over to Tony's but I don't see it as the same quality as Tony's should be. And a slice is $6+! That's way to pricy. Pepperoni pizza is always full of grease. Need napkins to soak it up before eating. I wish they had chicken pizza. Or a pizza punch card. Get your 10th slice free.
author: Jonathan F.

description: There aren't really any good pizza places in Mid-Market for weekday lunch and this place hits the spot. The slices may be pre-made and warmed up, but the NY style thin crust is oh so good! Their deep dish slices are also tasty.
author: Doug V.

description: Love Tony's Pizza so much! So excited to now have it in The Haight! I love that they have different styles of pizza. My favorite is The Grandma... SOOOOO GOOD!
author: Megan K.

description: Great atmosphere, amazing pie! Coming all the way from way up north and this will be my main stop in SF.
author: Jeff E.

description: This place is great! Super friendly staff (manager greeted me when she came out and was so kind), fast, well priced and really great food! Highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Becky D.

description: The food, ambiance, and service was excellent! We'll definitely be eating here on a regular basis! Thank you!
author: Laura V.

description: Great Pizza - but if you order to go, there's a high probability you won't get what you ordered.  The last three times I've ordered to go, NOT ONE of the orders was correct.  I think the crew there is taking breaks on Haight street and the second-hand smoke is getting to them.
author: David M.

description: Best pizza in the haight! After living in the mission I ended up moving to the food desert that is upper haight. Along came this spot and we finally have an oasis! Meat lovers is my personal favorite but it's all great!
author: Brian W.

description: I was anxious to try this place because I'd heard good things about Gemignani.  I ordered a slice of "Grandma."  They put it in the oven for a few minutes.  It had about five little pieces of Trader Joe's stick mozzarella and about six little green things, like blades of grass, and some itty-bitty, sparsely-placed pieces of tomato.  It was covered with what tasted like lard with sugar in it.  NASTY!!!  POO!!!  Two bites and it was in the compost bin.  I hope the worms don't get sick.  For $6.50 you can get TWO slices of almost always delish and interesting pizza at Arizmendi on Valencia.  As the Jewish people say, "Never again!"
author: Robert S.

description: We tried the Picante and Pepperoni pizza. Both were good and slices are big. However still somewhat expensive at $6 for a slice.
author: Renan F.

description: Been here 8 times in 3 months. This is arguably the best NY style pizza in San Francisco. It is insane that it doesn't have a line out the door. Come from the Marina; come from the Dogpatch; christ, come from the Peninsula. This place is worth it.
author: Matthew M.

description: Happen to stop by this place out of chance and wow the pizza is good! Definitely recommend it, if you happen to be in the area.
author: Cliff S.

description: Ordered a slice of 'grandma' today and it barely had any sauce. It had plenty of mozzarella but it was barely warm. That's a great slice when its actually hot and more than a single drizzle of sauce.  I paid over $6 for a thick piece of bread with room temperature slices of mozzarella. Super disappointing. Will just have to wait for whenever I go to the east bay and go to the WC location. Was never let down there.
author: Brooke F.

description: I had previously eaten at Tony's restaurant in North Beach, and always found it to be exceptional and among the best pizza places in SF (which is saying a lot, as we are home to some truly great pizza makers -- the New Yorkers who say otherwise are in denial).  I tried his new slice house on Upper Haight.  Wow!  I ate one of the best slices of pizza I have ever encountered.  The crust was perfect -- thin, just crispy enough, mildly charred (but not too charred).  And the toppings were fantastic, including some truly delicious little ripe, sweet tomatoes.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Tony S.

description: Hands down best pizza slices.  Easy to order and pick up.  The extra large pizza is 8 slices but really huge.  Think of it as 2 slices = 1 tony's slice.
author: around town e.

description: Amazing pizza Lemonade off the charts . Probably the best I've ever had !!! There hoodie dedicated to their restaurant is an amazing design very Haight street and unique. Hoodie $40 Tshirt  $20. Service was decent and Pizza was fresh and sooooo good . Had to wait 10 minutes as they just ran out of the Sicilian but worth the wait , my only complaint:)
author: Athena C.

description: I work on Haight street and come here all the time, this is just what Haight has been missing!! I don't understand any of the negative reviews, everything on this menu is completely customized. From what I understand, every Slice House has a menu that is customized to the neighborhood. I'm not going to go to Tony's in North Beach or on 2nd and write a negative review because they don't sell burgers at those places. It's weird that people care so much about menus. Let see some reviews about the customer service and food quality because everything here is AMAZING! :)
author: Dilan Y.

description: Walked in, ordered an extra large cheese...ten minutes later pizza heaven for 4 people.
author: John M.

description: I just came in after hearing all the buzz about this place. The manager recommended the slice Love Me Two Times which was so good! I was eyeballing the grandma slice and the purple haze for next time. The atmosphere was great, cool 90's music playing and very haight street style wall art. So glad we have a great pizza spot on haight!
author: Diyar Y.

description: Tony Gemignani does it again! Best pizza in the neighborhood! The Slice of the Day this past Saturday was the single best Slice of pizza I have ever had! A welcome addition to The Haight!
author: Trevor H.
